Class Fraction

java.lang.Object
Fraction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Number
public class Fraction extends Object implements Number
Fraction variable which implements the number interface Allows the storage of non integer values while avoiding floating points, as well as simple Fraction operationsm

    • Fraction

      public Fraction(double in, String name)

      Parameters:
      in - the double to be approximated
      name - the name of the variable

    • Fraction

      public Fraction(double in, int tolerance, String name)
      Basic constructor taking in a single double and approximating it to a Fraction with a custom tolerance
      Parameters:
      in - the double to be approximated
      tolerance - the set tolerance with the form of 5.0 * 10 ^ -n
      name - the name of the variable

    • approx

      public static Fraction approx(int in, int tolerance)
      An overload to approxumate the value when given an integer, setting it as a fraction with denominator 1
      Parameters:
      in - the integer to be approximated
      tolerance - the tolerance which is ignored, necessary for overload
      Returns:
      the approximated Fraction

    • approx

      public static Fraction approx(double in, int tolerance)
      Uses continued fractions to evaluate
      Parameters:
      in - the decimal to be approximated
      tolerance - the scientific notation exponent, for the differnce in the form of 5 * 10 ^ -n
      Returns:
      the fractional approximation of the provided touble, within the tolerance

    • evalContFrac

      public static double evalContFrac(String in)
      Evaluates a continued fraction in the form [a0;a1,a2,...,an]
      Parameters:
      in - a string of the continued fraction in proper form
      Returns:
      the double value of the continued fraction

    • contToFrac

      public static Fraction contToFrac(String in)
      Converts a coninued fraction in the form [a0;a1,a2,...,an], to a standard fraction Uses the algorithm discussed here: https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/3084970/how-to-convert-continued-fractions-into-normal-fractions
      Parameters:
      in - a String of a continued fraction in the proper form
      Returns:
      the Fraction variable representation of the continued fraction

    • fractToCont

      public static String fractToCont(Fraction in)
      UNFINISHED method that converts a fraction to a continued fraction
      Parameters:
      in - the input Fraction to be converted
      Returns:
      the string of hte continued fraction in the proper form [a0;a1,a2,...,an]

    • floatToCont

      public static String floatToCont(Float in, int tolerance)
      Converts the float taken in into a continued Fraction in the proper form [a0;a1,a2,...,an] Uses the algorith described here: https://youtu.be/f-86g6kSFG4
      Parameters:
      in - the decimal value to be converted
      tolerance - the scientific notation exponent of the accepted tolerance according to 5.0 * 10 ^ -n
      Returns:
      the proper coninued fraction form of the approximated decimal
